flow.descriptionCdata:
e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.3c0a5d87-ab41-455e-8f8f-4a9f2efa2b4d.prompt=Enter the SAS version used\: e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.735a16fe-09e1-4e84-a06e-94479248c324.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.9496b01c-9647-433d-8b25-927fc0c26897.description=Retrieves the HP SA agent reference being given the id of the device where it is hosted. This operation is supported from SA version 10.0 (sas10). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. deviceId - The id of the device where the searched HP SA agent is hosted. separator - The separator used for separating the results. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). Outputs\: agentId - The id of the HP SA agent. agentName - The name of the HP SA agent. Responses\: success - The operation has completed successfully. failure - The operation has failed. e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.970970fa-d46e-4797-803a-2710276168f2.description=Checks to see if a job is completed or not Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: running - job is still running completed - job has completed or is terminated in error failure - failed to retrieve data e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.a2add0e4-fdc7-4d48-8be5-5a9bbaf7ff74.description=
This operation can be used to find the SA version in the form of 'sasXXX' (Similar to the entries in the Selection List 'SAS Version'). Output of this operations  could be mapped to the input parameter 'coreVersion' which is used in other SA Operations. For SA version 6.x, this operation is not supported. For other SA versions, if the output variable 'coreVersion' is reported with 'UNKNOWN', then user is recommended to manually find the SA version to use in other SA Operations.

Inputs\:
coreHost - IP Address or DNS name of the SA Web Service.
corePort - HTTP(S) port of SA Web Service. By default it is '443'.
coreProtocol - HTTP / HTTPS. By default it is 'HTTPS'.
coreUsername - Username of the SA.
corePassword - Password of SA user.

Outputs\:
status - Operation completion Status.
coreVersion - SA version.  It could be one of [sas10, sas101, sas102, sas105, UNKNOWN].

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data
e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.b3bceae6-5e55-453d-86b9-14e18f2c44ed.description=Retrieves the properties for a Job Info. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: description - The description of this object. blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked. cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled. endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run. notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails. notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes. notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails. notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes. serverName - The name of the server associated with this job. serverId - The id of the server associated with this job. staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale. startDate - The date where this job started. status - This object's status. username - This object's user name. userTag - This object's unique user tag. e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.b62f3d5f-53e0-4169-94a3-968a16de986a.description=Starts deploying an agent on an unmanaged server. This operation is supported from SA version 10.1 (sas101). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverIPAddress - The IP address of the server on which the agent will be installed. protocol - Set the protocol used to login to the server on which the agent will be installed. If set to 'Select automatically', the job will try every protocol possible and use the first which is available. Possible values are\: ssh, telnet, netbt, rlogin. protocolPort - Set the port for the protocol specified above. If not set, the default port for the protocol will be used. username - The username for the server on which the agent will be installed. password - The password for the server on which the agent will be installed. rootPassword - Specify in case authentication is done as a non-root user, to become root (UNIX only). Set the value 'sudo' if the user is in the sudoers group, otherwise set the root password. actionType - Select the action type\: 'check' for checking if prerequisite conditions are fulfilled, 'download' for checking if prerequisite conditions are fulfilled and staging(downloading) the Agent installer binary or 'install' for checking if the prerequisite conditions are fulfilled, staging(downloading) the Agent installer binary and running the Agent installer binary. Default is 'install'. targetOSClass - Set the target OS class for the server on which the agent will be installed. Valid values are\: Windows, UNIX. realmName - The name of the realm. If set, the gateway inputs will be ignored. realmID - The ID of the realm. If set, the 'realmName' and the gateway inputs will be ignored. gatewayName - The name of the gateway. If set, the 'gatewayAddressInfo' must be specified. gatewayID - The ID of the gateway. If set, the 'gatewayAddressInfo' must be specified and the 'gatewayName' will be ignored. gatewayAddressInfo - The IP addresses and proxy ports of the gateways, in the format \:, separated by 'separator'. The IP addresses can be either version 4 (e.g. 192.168.55.22\:100) or version 6, which must be enclosed in brackets (e.g. [ff\:\:]\:100). If set, the gateway name or ID must be specified. noStartAgent - Do not start agent after installation. Default value is false. ignorePrerequisiteCheckFailures - Specify whether the deployment process should ignore any prerequisites check failures and proceed with the Agent installation. Default value is false. setTime - Set system time from HP Server Automation core. Default value is false. installMSI - Install Windows installer (MSI) if required (Windows only). Default value is false. reboot - Reboot at completion of successful install if warranted (Windows only). Default value is false. installRPM - Install Red Hat Package Manager (RPM) if required (AIX/Solaris only). Default value is false. resetConf - Reset agent configuration file to default settings. Default value is false. noOpswareGateway - Indicate that no Opsware gateway is necessary. Default value is false. overwriteInstaller - Specify whether HP SA Agent installer binary should be overwritten in case already staged. Default value is false. logLevel - The log level. Log levels are\: error, trace, warning, info. Default value is error. forceFullHardwareRegistration - Force full hardware registration. Default value is false. forceSoftwareRegistration - Force software registration. Default value is false. noReachabilityCheck - Suppress agent reachability check. Default value is false. noAnonymousSSL - Disable anonymous SSL. Applies to dormant agent only. Default value is false. forceNewDevice - Force creation of new device record if conflict found. Default value is false. failOnHardwareRegistrationError - Fail if initial hardware registration fails (do not go dormant). Default value is false. doNotOpenWindowsFirewall - Set 'true' to not open Windows firewall for core-agent communications. Default value is false. remediateSoftwarePolicy - Perform a remediate of Software Policies after install. Default value is false. softwarePolicyID - The ID of the software policy to attach. fingerprint - Fingerprint of the peer's certificate. Default value is false. installerOptions - Set the command line arguments for the HP SA Agent installer. userTag - An user provided tag applicable to this job. timeout - The maximum time, in seconds, within which this method should complete and the operation should return. The job will fail with a timeout error if the Install HP SA Agent operation does not complete in the given number of seconds. The default value is 0 (no timeout). separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The time zone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Outputs\: jobId - The ID of the job created for installing a HP SA Agent on a server. Responses\: success - The operation has completed successfully. failure - The operation has failed. e9bb7df0-596f-4688-ab48-462e041bae91.fcfc95b1-d2e5-4c5c-9e96-318f44247c6e.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at.
to - The number to count to.
incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. If unspecified this is 1. If you wanted to count 2,4,6,8 this would be 2.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

NOTE\: These values must be between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Note\: the primary result is resultString, Result can also be used. result (All lower case) should not be used as it is the response code.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
flow.name: Installar Agente

step.name: Find HP SA Agents By Device Id
